content.description: Low unprotected crux to a thin crack. Crack to small ledge then right share anchor with Diagonal Crack.
content.location: Center of wall between dihedral and large class 4 opening used to access top.

content.description: Climb the cryptic and bouldery crux on sharp crimps and pockets to the large horizontal crack 15' up where white trash traverses in from the right. Finish with the relatively easy 5.9+ crux of white trash.
content.protection: This line is usually top-roped, but can be lead with a crash pad and the same gear as White Trash.
content.location: Find the small chalked up holds directly below the anchors of White Trash. It is located about halfway between the start of Total Trash and the normal White Trash.

content.description: Start in the wide corner and work left at the low horizontal. Quickly move through the fun, technical face on small, sloping ledges, making for one or two somewhat strenous gear placements. Recoup on the large ledge before tackling the finishing roof where the extended anchor chains can be clipped before committing to the finishing moves.
content.protection: Pro to 3". Specifically nuts and #'s .75 and 3 Camalots. Sling a sketchy chicken head for encouragement. Equalized chain anchor.
content.location: Begins in the obvious corner at the White Trash Wall, 40' left of the chimney, Fat Crack (5.6).

content.description: Boulder crux start to good positve hold 15' up. Continue on good hold and beer left towards Tandem Slide anchors.
content.location: Middle of white trash wall. Shares anchors with Tandem Slide.

climbs.name: Tandem Slide aka Last Waltz
climbs.fa: TS - Jerry Cagle, Keith Smith 1987; TLW - Jerry Cagle, Todd Scarlet 1988

content.description: Left most route on White Trash Wall. Starts right of the arête, up the crack system on good holds, and pull onto the steep bulge.
content.location: Left most route on WT wall.

content.description: Climb up to the lone bolt then slightly left to the arête.  Follow the jugs to the top.
content.location: Just around the corner from Boston Rag, the start is a little right of the arête.

content.description: Low crux protected by one bolt leads to a great jug lined arête.
content.protection: 1 bolt, SR with some small doubles, bolt anchors
content.location: This is the arête just right of Boston Rag.

content.description: Although rarely done, this route climbs quite well. Follow a thin crack up to a juggy horizontal, place awkward pro, then commit to the crux sequence up the thin seam. Follow larger holds with great horizontals up the pumpy headwall.
content.protection: SR. No anchors. No good tree. Recommend dropping anchors with a long static line before leading.
content.location: The center of the clean wall to the left of the Local Honey and the graffiti cave. (A few faces climber's left of the White Trash area).

content.description: Start on a fallen ledge below a brown bolt. Pull the crux, then head up a nice clean face to the upper headwall. A couple fun, reachy moves lead to another bolt.  Pull through the blocky ledges above to an anchor.
content.protection: Standard rack, nuts important, bolt anchors
content.location: Scooped green and white face, fifty feet left of "Tandem Slide" on White Trash Wall

content.description: Climb a crack with face holds up to a ledge at about 20 ft. Plug in a #2bd in the weird hole/pocket. Move left and cruise up the face roughly 10 ft. left of the outside corner. There is one spot between the ledge and the top that accepts gear. Don't miss it. Move left to anchors which is 2 bolts with only 1 hanger. The nut is on the other bolt so you can use a wire. Walk right to another set of anchors to rappel. Nice little route with a heady finish.
content.protection: Small to medium cams. (1) #2 camalot. Anchors for belaying on the left and anchors for rappelling on the right.
content.location: Start this climb down to the left of White Trash on the same face about 10 ft right of the outside corner at a conspicuous crack that leads to a ledge.

climbs.name: Hold my Beer I got this

content.description: Protection is small but solid. With fun edges and pinches
content.location: The route is in between You crack me up and Bash the jugs. You use the anchor for Bash the Jugs.

content.description: Climb the wide crack 45 feet on good rock to the top.
content.location: On the right wall of the White Trash Area, just right of the walkup, this is the wide crack.

content.description: Climb the arete on the left side of the walkup.  Head up and left in the diagonal crack, which starts 15 feet up.  Follow it on good rock to the top.
content.protection: Gear to 3".  Rap on trees or walkdown.  There may be bolts now.
content.location: On the right wall of the White Trash area, this is the diagonal crack just left of the walkup.  Start on the left arete of the walkup.

content.description: Good practice chimney with easy stemming the whole way up.
content.protection: Pro is a little thin.  Anchor on tree at the top on the left side.
content.location: The big chimney where Diagonal Crack starts.

content.description: Climb the handcrack that narrows to a fingercrack up the slightly slabby wall.  Finish on chickenheads.  Good rock.
content.protection: Gear to 3".  Tree anchor.  Rap or walkdown.
content.location: On the right end of the right wall of the White Trash Area, this is the handcrack up the middle of the face.

content.description: Climb the face on the right side of the dihedral using the numerous chickenheads.  Decent rock.
content.protection: Gear to 3.5", slings.  Rap off trees or walkdown.
content.location: On the right wall of the White Trash area, this climb is the face just right of the dihedral formed by the intersection of both walls.

content.description: Top roper's paradise.  Also has some good moderate and easy leads on west and south faceing good quality rock.
